p: In 2017, an amendment to the Pharmaceutical Law (the so-called “Pharmacy for the Pharmacist”) was adopted. This act allows new pharmacies to be opened only by pharmacists, limits the number of pharmacies, and sets geographical and demographic limits. Thus, currently, it is prohibited in Poland to create a pharmacy chain. One pharmacist (or a partnership of pharmacists) may run a maximum of four pharmacies. The pharmacy chains existing until 25 June 2017 can still operate in the market, but they cannot expand [ 10]. Existing pharmacies can only be resold to pharmacists or pharmacists’ partnerships.
